p: Compound 2 was obtained as a yellow colored amorphous solid. A molecular formula of C 16H 17NO 4 for compound 2 was deduced from the positive-mode HR-TOF-ESI-MS ( m/z: 288.1176 [M + H] +) ( Figure S5). Based on its 1D ( 1H and 13C) (Figures S6–S8) and 2D (HMBC and HMQC) spectral data, compound 2 was unambiguously characterized as lycorine ( Figure 2) [ 22, 24, 25]. Lycorine is the first and the most abundant alkaloid reported from the genus and the family Amaryllidaceae [ 26, 27].
